intro: Hibbertia virotii, commonly known as the Narrow-leaf False Nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers with five petals, typically blooming from late winter to early spring. Hibbertia virotii is often found in coastal heathlands and sand dunes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It is a herbaceous perennial that is relatively low maintenance and suitable for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
